phrases: That Sunday... I...
What made you want to come to the park all of a sudden, Emi?
Come on down, it is dangerous.
I am going to be a pianist!
At the top of the jungle gym,
I chose a future as a pianist.
I abandoned all my other infinite possibilities, and chose that one.
Come back!
Come back!
Now, now, where are your manners?
How do you do?
I am Yuriko Ochiai.
What is your name?
Um...
What is it?
So that people who hear me will think, I want to be a pianist, too...
Will I be able to play the piano like that, too?
Come back!
If you wish for it hard enough, Emi-chan, I am sure that the music will respond to you.
The piano will listen to you.
Can I play it?
Of course.
That is the only kind of sound I can make...
But the sounds that boy made
were just like sunflowers...
Kousei Arima, who I yearned to be like.
Every great performer played for the first time at some point.
Even Mozart, even Beethoven.
Even the person who made you think, I want to become a pianist.
What will you pour into your piano playing?
What wish will you ask it to grant you?
I want to play the piano like that boy.
I want to stand on the same stage as him.
That way, I just know...
That I will be able to see what he sees.
Let it ring...
Let it ring...
My piano!
Let it ring.
Is that girl for real?
That was insane.
Entrance to Greenrooms
Good job.
You were amazing!
What?
What?
You confessing your love?
Sorry.
I am going to go change.
Before you catch a cold.
Just spill it already!
Right now...there is no need for words.
Because I poured all my feelings into the piano.
There will now be an intermission.
Judging will resume in fifteen minutes.
Did you see that girl who just left?
What a pile of medication.
Huh?
Yo, just spotted a hot girl!
What is the matter, Tsubaki-chan?
The closer it gets to Kousei's turn, my stomach...
It is so much easier to deal with my own matches!
It is not like you are the one who will be playing, Tsubaki-chan,
so just sit back and relax!
I know, but is Kousei going to be all right?
Just spotted an angelic older woman!
He could be quaking in his shoes after that amazing performance.
And that is so not happening.
Because you know what, he is a man!
We will now resume judging.
Thump, thump.
My heart's pounding even harder than before.
Arima's choice of piece today is Chopin's Etude Op. 25 No. 5
Inconceivable!
Till now, Arima's always showcased his ability to play difficult pieces without a false note.
That is why I challenged him with my Op. 25, No. 11...
I am sure Takeshi did, too...
But the song Arima chose to play today cannot be considered a difficult piece...
It is inconceivable.
How did you pick out Kousei's piece?
It landed on 25-5, so...
You used a pencil to decide?
A pencil...
It did not matter what piece he played.
As long as he entered the competition.
It really did not matter at all.
Kousei Arima.
Please get ready.
All right.
Just by placing himself in this particular space, he is sure to feel stimulated.
There is no way he will not feel provoked.
The other pianists will not let him hang back.
They will not allow him to stop.
After all, Arima-kun's a musician.
This is so strange.
Is it because it is been two years?
My heart is pounding.
It is so hot, and so violent.
Is it because I watched those two perform?
Without holding back, grasping with both hands, shaking my soul to its very core.
Check it out - this is who I am.
Watch me!
I am the same as you.
I am sure the clock's hands will move.
Time will start flowing again.
Kao-chan...
I never knew.
That music could be this colorful, and that it even had a scent.
Are you ready?
I believe that he will take a step forward.
So music can make your blood boil this hard.
Here he is!
It is Arima-kun.
Arima...
Arima...
Now even I am nervous!
I want to go to the bathroom!
Hey...
Here he is at last, huh?
Are you ready for your journey?
Come on, we are going to play dodgeball!
You can just dodge all the time, okay?
Tsubaki...
I am in the middle of a lesson with my mom.
Whaaat?
Not again?
Huh?
How did you get that welt?
I was in a hurry, and I bumped my arm.
You really are a klutz, are not you?
Kousei, hurry back now!
Whoa, that scared me!
Sorry, my mom's calling me, Tsubaki.
Ask me another time?
Sure.
Okay, then, good luck!
Chelsea
Sit yourself down.
All right, let us begin, Kousei.
No running in the halls.
Okay!
I brought you your laundry, Mom.
Oh, Kousei.
How did it go?
The Nagai Memorial Competition?
I got first place.
Here is the certificate.
But Haydn's given you such trouble.
I practiced a ton!
Good for you.
That makes me feel better.
Your achievements are the best medicine for me, Kousei.
Well, I will take first place again!
If it makes you better, Mom,
I will take first place as many times as you want.
So...
What is the matter?
He is standing still?
Do not waver.
Do not be afraid.
Dammit, it is overpowering me!
We are all afraid, you know.
Go on!
Go on!
Go on!
Go on!
There is Kousei, under the spotlight again.
He is back.
The invincible one, the pianist who is a breed apart.
The one I looked up to...
Kousei Arima.
He is back...
His unmatched accuracy.
His playing - like a mirror image of the score.
The stainless steel-like piano inaccessible to the rest of us.
This is the Kousei Arima of two years ago.
I can hear the notes.
My fingers are moving.
I can play the score exactly as I have memorized it.
I can play on the strength of my muscle memory.
How does the real you want to play this?
This is no different than how I have always played.
That is how it should be.
A musician should be a mirror that reflects the score.
Besides, you cannot win unless you do it this way.
You are going to get first place for me again, are not you, Kousei?
You were playing the piano this morning again?
I came to buy food.
Since my dad's away on business, it is for me and my mom.
Hey, it is just egg sandwiches!
That is not very healthy.
Well, she will not let me use a knife.
I will bring you something to eat.
We have oden leftover from yesterday.
How is your mom doing, Kousei?
My mom said she has not been feeling well.
She is going to be hospitalized soon.
But why?
I am sure...
It is all my fault.
Huh?
What?
Oh, nothing.
My mom got mad because I could not play the way she told me to, and she ruined her health.
So I am going to take first place,
and make her well again.
First Place - Arima Kousei
Kousei Arima - The Child Prodigy
Arima's in first again?
The Human Metronome, huh?
Just go overseas already!
Bland and innocuous.
He is so in my way!
And he is nothing but his mother's puppet!
Shut up, shut up!
None of you know what you are talking about.
I am the only one who is on Mom's side.
Next time, my mom's coming from the hospital to see me perform.
Oh, really?
So your mom's recovered now?
That is great!
I bet it is all thanks to that visit from handsome me.
And my candy erasers!
Well, I do not think Kousei's mom knew what to do with them.
The entrance on the left side, facing the audience.
A spot where I can see her.
That is my mom's special seat.
Mom's here today.
Right.
Thanks.
So you see,
in order to make Mom well again,
in order to make her happy,
I am going to play my very best as a gift for her!
What are you doing, Saki?
Just what do you call that performance?
How many times have I told you to review the score?
You idiot!
Stop it, Saki!
Too harsh...
But I have never heard Arima-kun play better...
Misplaying both the third and eleventh measures!
I am going to get one of the staff.
You make mistakes like that because you are drowning in your own emotions!
You are not going to bed until you can play that part.
Why cannot you even play an easy piece like that?
You are so worthless!
I am in the middle of a lesson with my mom.
Whaaat?
Messing up the same part!
That kid's covered with bruises.
That is why he always wears long sleeves.
Who would be that harsh with a kid?
She is a monster.
How dare you throw that score - you should be ashamed of yourself!
All I wanted was for you to be happy.
Even when I wanted to play with Tsubaki and Watari, even when you hit me,
I put up with it...
I put up with it, and kept practicing...
All I wanted was for you to get better...
All I wanted was for you to be happy...
And yet...
I wish you would just die.
That was the last time I said anything to my mom.
Kousei?
Hmm?
Are you going to compete in the final?
Yeah.
Since I did get through the prelims.
I know it is awful.
My mother just passed away,
and here I am, worrying about the competition in a few days.
How awful is that?
Are you okay?
Sure I am okay.
Because that is how I was built, after all.
I cannot remember my mother's face that day.
It is like there is a big black hole peering back at me.
His mother just passed away, did not she?
How can he play the piano like nothing happened?
He is not off by even a fraction.
It is business as usual with him.
He is a demonic chip off the old block!
The entrance on the left side, facing the audience.
A spot where I can see her.
That is my mom's special seat.
This is... this is my punishment.
That is right, this is your punishment.
You understand that, do not you?
My darling, darling little Kousei.
The notes...
Huh?
The sound of the piano...
I cannot hear it.
He is starting to unravel.
About Arima-kun...
Rumor has it that he cannot hear the notes anymore.
Resonance
Episode 10 The Place I Was at With You
